explanation: The report is correct. The for statement is not well-formed under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 for multiple reasons: (1) There are two loop counters (i and j) in effect — the loop header increments both (++i, ++j) which violates the requirement that there shall be only one loop counter in a for loop and that the third clause shall modify only that loop counter. (2) The second clause uses both i and j (quoted_len > i && unquoted_len > j), whereas the second clause is allowed to reference only the loop counter (and optional boolean loop-control flags). (3) The loop body modifies i (i++ when a backslash is seen), which violates the prohibition on modifying the loop counter inside the loop body. Any of these points means the for loop fails to meet Rule 14.2; together they confirm the reported violation.
